intro: Angadenia poeppigii, commonly known as the yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas and prefers well-drained soil. Angadenia poeppigii is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant color and unique appearance.
